org.xflatdb.xflat.db

Class IdAccessor<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.db.IdAccessor<T>

  • public class IdAccessor<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class that accesses the IDs of an object.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getPojoType

        public java.lang.Class<T> getPojoType()

      • forClass

        public static <U> IdAccessor<U> forClass(java.lang.Class<U> pojoType)
        Gets the IdAccessor for the given pojo type. Id Accessors are cached statically so that the reflection is only performed once.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the class for which to get the accessor.
        Parameters:
        pojoType - The type of the class for which to get the accessor.
        Returns:
        The accessor, which may have already been created and cached.

      • hasId

        public boolean hasId()
        Indicates whether the POJO introspected by this accessor has an ID property.
        Returns:
        true if an ID property or field was detected.

      • getIdType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getIdType()

      • getIdValue

        public java.lang.Object getIdValue(T pojo)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                   java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Gets the value of the ID by accessing the ID property or field on the object. If the ID is a JavaBean property, the property's getter is invoked via reflection. If the ID is a field, the field is retrieved via reflection.
        Parameters:
        pojo - The object whose ID to get.
        Returns:
        The value of the object's ID property or field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        See Also:
        Method.invoke(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object[]), Field.get(java.lang.Object)

      • setIdValue

        public void setIdValue(T pojo,
              java.lang.Object id)
                throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                       java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Sets the object's ID property or field to the given value. If the ID is a JavaBean property, the property's setter is invoked via reflection. If the ID is a field, the field is set via reflection.
        Parameters:
        pojo - The object whose ID should be set
        id - The new value of the ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        See Also:
        Method.invoke(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object[]), Field.set(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)
